column2: ems714, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: First, let me tell you about myself. I am 5' 3" and I WAS 150 pounds which according to BMI charts, I was considered overweight. I had an immense appetite and didn't exercise much. I had also taken Phentermine in the past and was admitted in the hospital for cardiac arrhythmias and anxiety. After the phentermine experience, I was a little apprehensive about weight loss meds. I retrieved Sibutramine in Mexico by a pharmasict who boasted NO side effects and guaranteed weight loss so I figured I'd give it a shot. I LOVE THIS DRUG. I went from 150 to 135 pounds in 2 weeks. This medication helped me eat smaller portions at mealtimes and decreased my desire for greasy fast food. I did however experience a few very minkr side effects that do not interfere much. After taking this medication, my bowel habits went from 4 a week to about 2 a week, i do experience very minor almost unnoticeable palpitations and in the beginning, i had a few episodes ofinsomnia. Along with cutting the junk food, i stopped eating after 7pm and increased my water intake. I think if you really are looking to lose weight, you should try this medication especially if you don't want the trembly shaky feeling you get with other meds like phentermine or other stimulants. Good luck and hope this helps!

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
G. WALKER, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Caregiver)
column9: THIS MEDICATION MAKE ME LOOSE A LOT WEIGHT.BEFORE I TRY EVERYTHING EVEN EXERCISING I WAS FEELING FRUSTRATED,BUT WITH THE SIBUTRAMINE I LOOSE LIKE 50 POUNDS A READY.NOW I HAVE ONE PROBLEM, MAYBE BECAUSE THIS MEDICATION.MY SYMPTOMS ARE :SOMETIMES ONLY, SOME PART OF MY BODY I FEEL LIKE ARE TREBLING,OR SHAKING, OR VERY OFTEN I GET DIZZY,SOMETIMES I DON'T FEEL MY TOES AND MY HANDS ARE VERY COLD.THE PROBLEM IS NOW I DON'T HAVE INSURANCE.I HOPE SOMEBODY CAN HELP ME.

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I love this drug, i have been on it for 19 days and i have lost 15 lbs. It is great. I have had dry mouth and a little bit of dizzyness and tiredness.

column2: miss30865, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: today is my first day on this med. i got it in mexico highly recommended by the pharmacist and other people who have used it.... we will see. i do have a funny taste in my mouth and i am thirsty. my vision is a little blurry, but other than that nothing too serious..

column2: 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: My son was pushing 186 @ 12 y/o and for the past 6 months he has dropped to 159 LBS. He has been on this medication along with education on nutrition and an active lifestyle.  I am so proud of him, and I am still encouraging him to fulfull his dreams nothing is impossible. (Proud Father)

column2: angienv, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month
column9: been on it for two weeks lost 8 pounds and am loving it .

column2: inthenavy, 19-24 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have a question regarding this drug.  Does anyone know if this drug will make you test positive for amphetamines on a urinalysis? Some other site reviews state this but I cannot find if its true. I am taking it but I will be joining the Navy and do not want to appear like a drug user.

column2: Nena, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
sweetapple, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I've been on alot of diets, but nothing has worked but, this has really worked for me.. I've been on this for 3 months and I've lost 42 pounds and I workout 3 times aweek. I haven't had any side effects. and I'm so proud of myself cause this is something I'm doing for myself and for my health. I've learned that diets don't work. But healthly ,eating does and this is a life choice, eating health everyday.

column2: MELIHDZ, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have been using this medication for about a month now and have lost 10lbs.  Of course with a watchful diet and exercies.  I a very happy with my results and no longer have the hunger I use to have.  I have lost 9 inches around my waist. I feel great, but usually have dry mouth and mild head aches after I work out. Nothing a little water and asprin can't cure.

column2: NVU, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Since starting this drug, I've had to visit the ER for extreme dizziness, migranes, and heart palpitations.  Felt like I was going to have a heart attack.

column2: Minnie , 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: This medication was giving to me by a Mexican doctor and at first i was a bit scare since previously tried another brand and got severe side effects but since my weight was getting to be on the danger zone I started taking it hoping this time will work. Side effects do change by day. sometimes i have dry mouth and funny taste others, may be hearth palpitations but overall i feel great, I no longer have the cravings i used to have and i already lost 10 pounds in 22 days taking this medication.

column2: Consmo683, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I've been using it for 5 weeks now, i'm diabetic, i have high cholesterol, and i was weighting 204 when i started; now i'm down to 186Lbs. I'm only taking 10mg, and i'm fallowing my Dr's instructions, I'm very happy with the results

column2: Happysocks, 35-44 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: of course everyone is different and will have different reactions, but for me it has been rgeat. i have not had any side affects. My craving for food has gone away to the point where I forget to eat sometimes, which then I might get a headache which for me is normal if I dont eat. Ultimately it all comes down to determination and will power. No pill will ever be the solution, but it can help.

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I started taking this medication to lose weight. Unfortunately, my appetite did not decrease at all. Instead, I was anxious and nervous all of the time, my palms were always sweaty, my mood changed drastically. The side effect that bothered me most was the insomnia- I literally didn't sleep for days, and when I did, it wasn't a solid sleep.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: one day left side of face was swollen left side of chest hurting.

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I took Meridia under the advice of my physcian and lost approximately 45 pounds in about 8 months.  I also added exercise about 5 days a week.  This totally curbed by hunger.  My only complaint is that when I stopped taking it, my hunger returned and it is very hard to maintain my current weight now!  I am still exercising, but I am hungry all the time!

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I started to use it, and let me tell you I am one of those persons that get really nervous about taking weight control pills.  The fist day I guess it was more excitement than anything else but, I felt a little hyper my heart was beating faster than usual.  The next day I did not have any symptoms.  It is my second refill and I have lost 10 lbs.  My cravings that I would usually get are gone.  Overeating has stopped.  My energy lever has gone from zero to 10 being 10 the highest.  I can even say that it has relived me of my depression.  I would definite recommend it.
